glossary.definition: A step in the multi-step course creation process
Unpublished course state that can be edited
Checklist of requirements that must be met before course can be published
Automatic saving of wizard state to prevent data loss
Course structure: modules, lessons, and content items

business_rules: Course creation wizard has multiple phases: Planning, Curriculum, Content, Pricing, Instructor Profile, Landing Page, Publishing
Course must be saved as draft after each phase
Auto-save must occur every 30 seconds or on field blur
Wizard state must persist across browser sessions
Course cannot be published until all required fields are completed
Publishing validation checklist must be passed before publish
Curriculum must have at least one module with one lesson
Course must have instructor profile before publishing
Course must have landing page content before publishing
Draft courses can be edited at any time
Published courses can be unpublished to return to draft
Wizard must validate fields before allowing phase progression
Wizard must show progress indicator (e.g., 3/7 phases complete)
Wizard must allow navigation between completed phases
Wizard must prevent skipping required phases
calculations_or_formulas: Content statistics = sum of lessons, videos, resources per module
invariants: Course must be in 'draft' status during wizard
Course status can only change: draft → published (or draft → unpublished)
Wizard phases must be completed in order (cannot skip)
Course must have at least one module before publishing
Course must have instructor profile before publishing
Auto-save must not overwrite unsaved user changes
edge_cases: User closes browser during wizard (state must be recoverable)
Multiple users editing same course draft simultaneously
User navigates away from wizard mid-phase
Course deleted while wizard is open
Instructor profile deleted while course is being created
User tries to publish course with incomplete curriculum

inputs: Course metadata (title, description, category, level, language, tags)

user_journeys: Instructor clicks 'Create Course' → enters course metadata → saves → moves to curriculum phase → adds modules and lessons → saves → moves to content phase → uploads videos/content → saves → moves to pricing → sets price → saves → moves to instructor profile → completes profile → saves → moves to landing page → creates landing page → saves → moves to publishing → validates → publishes course
Instructor opens draft course → wizard resumes at last phase → edits content → auto-saves → continues editing → publishes
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Wizard has all required phases and allows navigation
Auto-save works correctly and doesn't lose data
Wizard state persists across browser sessions
Validation prevents progression with incomplete data
Draft courses can be edited and republished
Wizard allows preview of course before publishing
open_questions: What are the exact wizard phases? (Planning, Curriculum, Content, Pricing, Instructor, Landing Page, Publishing?)
How often should auto-save occur? (30 seconds? On field blur?)
What fields are required in each phase?
What happens to draft courses that are never published?
Should there be a course template system?
Can multiple instructors collaborate on course creation?
What is the maximum course size? (modules, lessons, content)
assumptions: Wizard is a single-page application with phase navigation
Auto-save uses debouncing to avoid excessive API calls
Wizard state is stored in backend, not just frontend
Publishing validation is comprehensive and includes all requirements
Draft courses are visible only to creator until published
